questions.questionText: Five people A, B, C, D, E are sitting in a row facing North. A is to the left of B. C is to the right of B. E is between A and B. Who is in the middle?
questions.explanation: Arrangement: A-E-B-C-D or A-E-B-D-C. In either case, B is in the middle position (3rd)

questions.questionText: Four friends P, Q, R, S are sitting in a row. P and Q are sitting together. S is not sitting at either end. Who must be at one end?
questions.explanation: Since P and Q sit together and S is not at ends, R must be at one end

questions.questionText: Five people are sitting in a circle facing center. A is second to the left of B. C is immediate right of B. Who is second to the right of A?
questions.explanation: If A is 2nd left of B, and C is immediate right of B, then C is 2nd right of A

questions.questionText: Six people sitting in a row facing North. P is third from left end. Q is immediate right of P. How many people are between Q and the right end?
questions.explanation: P is 3rd from left, Q is 4th from left. In a row of 6, there are 2 people after Q (5th and 6th positions)

questions.questionText: Three people A, B, C are sitting in a straight line facing South. A is to the left of B. If someone facing them points to their 'left', which direction is it for A, B, C?
questions.explanation: They face South, so their left is East. From opposite person's view (facing North), pointing left means East for the sitters
